qas.question: What is long-distance running as a food hunting-gathering technique?
What theory says that long-distance running drove the evolution of some human traits?
Besides the endurance running hypothesis, what other theory of food collection is there?
What food gathering techniques could have been used by early man at the same time?

plausible_answers.text: leading to the evolution of certain human characteristics

qas.question: Short-distance running was the driving evolutionary force for what?
What is a method practiced by all hunter-gatherer groups in modern times?
The scavenging hypothesis is still practiced by which groups?
What contradicts with the scavenging hypothesis?

context: According to <b8_0>the <a1_0>endurance running hypothesis<b8_0/><a1_0/>, long-distance running as in <a0_0><b6_0>persistence hunting<b6_0/><a0_0/>, a method still practiced by <a2_0>some <b7_0>hunter-gatherer<b7_0/> groups<a2_0/> in modern times, was likely the driving evolutionary force <b5_0>leading to the evolution of certain human characteristics<b5_0/>. This hypothesis does not necessarily contradict the <a3_0>scavenging hypothesis<a3_0/>: <a4_0>both subsistence strategies<a4_0/> could have been in use – sequentially, alternating or even simultaneously.
